image.altText: A mass of protesters carrying signs that say "guilty".

props.synopsis: Donald Trump has been found guilty on 34 felony counts of falsifying business records in his New York criminal trial relating to "hush money" payments paid to adult film star Stormy Daniels. Follow live.

image.altText: Donald Trump sits in court in a suit and red tie looking at the camera

props.synopsis: Forced to endure five weeks of painstaking testimony inside a drab Manhattan courthouse, a dozen New Yorkers were drawn into a House-of-Cards world of scandal, skulduggery and sex.

title.children: 'The boss would be furious at me': What we learned from the trial that delivered Trump a guilty verdict

image.altText: Donald Trump in court

props.synopsis: The jury in Donald Trump's "hush money" trial finds the former president guilty of 34 counts of falsifying business records, a felony that could result in prison time.Â

title.children: Donald Trump becomes first US president to be found guilty of a crime

image.altText: A dark sky with trees in the foreground.

props.synopsis: A 5,000-kilometre-long cloud band travelling west to east is expected to drench parts of the country over the coming days. Following a second rainband, a separate weather system is threatening to bring heavy rain from NSW to Tasmania from Saturday to Thursday.

title.children: Three weather systems combine for an ongoing Australia-wide soaking

image.altText: Chrystal blue waters and swimmers.

props.synopsis: They're home to subtropical beaches that city slickers dream of, but an emerging trend shows some regional movers are moving away again from Australia's most popular regional cities after arrival.

title.children: Growing pains turn movers away from popular coastal cities as 'the dream is not always what they presume'

The rapid rise of Chinese electric vehicles has been met with resistance in the US and Europe. So why are Australians buying them at record levels?

title.children: Why Chinese-made cars are becoming so common on Australia's roads

image.altText: A hooded man holds a laptop computer as cyber code is projected on him.

image.altText: A close-up of a little girl sitting on a hospital bed with her arm bandaged and clutching a panda bear.

props.synopsis: Ten-year-old Lama was dressed and her bag packed to escape Gaza after seven months of war when Israel invaded Rafah and closed the only crossing out of the enclave.

title.children: Ten-year-old Lama was moments away from fleeing Rafah. Then tanks arrived on her doorstep

image.altText: Andrew Giles looking slightly confused in Question Time

props.synopsis: It was a direction meant to bring a "common sense" approach to appeals by non-citizen criminals who have their visas cancelled. Instead, "direction 99" caused a furore after it was used to reinstate the visa of a man who now stands accused of murder. Here's what it's about.

title.children: What is the immigration 'direction 99' causing Andrew Giles and the government so much trouble?

image.altText: A close up of Donald Trump speaking with pursed lips

props.synopsis: Donald Trump may have been found guilty on all counts for illegally covering up a hush money payment, but the verdict will not prevent the former president from pursuing his campaign to retake the White House.

title.children: Will Donald Trump go to jail? Can he still be president? Here's what happens next

image.altText: Two men in suits stand at lecterns for a press conference.

props.synopsis: New Zealand Prime Minister Christopher Luxon has told Anthony Albanese it's concerning the government intends to rewrite 'direction 99' rules that will lead to more Kiwis convicted of crimes in Australia being deported to NZ.

title.children: New Zealand PM calls Albanese to state displeasure over 'direction 99' criminal deportation change

image.altText: A graphic of a yellow sun on a pink background, behind the photos of two young girls and a boy, and vote box.

props.synopsis: As Australia marks its first Reconciliation Week since voting no to an Indigenous Voice to Parliament, young First Nations people and advocates for change say they are still hopeful the country can heal, but that truth-telling will be key.

title.children: What does reconciliation look like in a no-vote world? Young Indigenous people share their hopes for the future

image.altText: Aircraft flying against blue sky.

props.synopsis: Perth Airport's split terminals will be consolidated into one complex, ending years of confusion for travellers, following a new deal struck with Qantas.

title.children: Perth Airport terminals to be consolidated into one complex, in new Qantas deal

image.altText: Bruce Lehrmann walks away as a TV camera films him.

props.synopsis: Today marks the deadline for former Liberal staffer Bruce Lehrmann to lodge an appeal against a ruling in the Federal Court that found on the balance of probabilities he raped Brittany Higgins at Parliament House in 2019.

title.children: Bruce Lehrmann's deadline to appeal findings of failed defamation case runs out today

image.altText: Zach Merrett and Jade Gresham celebrate

props.synopsis: After last season ended with a whimper for Essendon, a host of the club's leaders embarked on an off-season trip to a world-renowned training facility in the United States. The result has been one of its best starts to a season in the last two decades. Here's a look at what the Bombers did in Arizona.

image.altText: A sign that reads "Foxwell State Secondary College" in front of a school beneath a clear sky.

props.synopsis: The Queensland Department of Education is investigating a social media post that ranks female students from a Gold Coast secondary school into disturbing sexist categories.

image.altText: King Chales in red uniform with tall black fluffy hat covering his eyes as he sits on black horse.

image.altText: CCTV vision of Yahya Sinwar disappearing into a tunnel.

image.altText: Large ship seen from above.

image.altText: Dr Johnson is looking directly at the camera, wearing glasses, a grey suit and patterned tie
